report.title: Reporting Channels
report.phishing_desc: Forward suspicious emails to CyberSecurity Malaysia

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: What should I do if I've been scammed?
faq.a1: Immediately contact your bank if money was involved, then report to police and CyberSecurity Malaysia.
faq.q2: How can I verify if a website is legitimate?
faq.a2:
1. Check the URL for misspellings
2. Look for the padlock icon and https:// prefix
3. Verify contact details through official channels
4. Be wary of websites asking for too much personal information
faq.q3: Is it safe to click links in SMS messages?
faq.a3: It's not recommended to click links in unsolicited SMS. Even if it appears to be from your bank, log in directly through the official app or website to verify.

tips.title: Cybersecurity Tips
tips.tip1: Never share your OTP or banking details with anyone
tips.tip2: Verify website URLs before entering sensitive information
tips.tip3: Use strong, unique passwords for different accounts
